intro: Halimocnemis glauca, commonly known as the blue-green halimocnemis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, blue-green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique coloration and compact growth make it a distinctive component of its native ecosystems.
